activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12149
activity.text:
@nihal467 i have started work regarding the issue can you assign me the issue 

I have seen in other forms like questionnarie form the auto scroll is working fine because there it uses react-hook-form which will bydefault porvides the service of auto scroll or focuing the fields with validiation failure but it wont work for custom component like datepicker and select boxes for that we need to do the below solution 

solution  :  
- Use formState.errors  from React Hook Form to get the list of validation errors.
- Use Object.keys(errors) to get all fields with errors.
- Identify the first field with an error.
- Use the ref or  id of the field to locate it in the DOM.
- Use scrollIntoView to bring the field into view:

END DATE : TODAY

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12139
activity.text:
@Jacobjeevan @rithviknishad i would like to work on this issue can you assign me this issue.

solution : 
- Extract the camera stopping logic (stream.getTracks().forEach(track => track.stop())) into a reusable function, e.g., stopMediaStream, in a common utility file.
- Update both CameraCaptureDialog.tsx and AvatarEditModal.tsx to use this shared utility for stopping the camera stream.
- Use the utility immediately after photo capture/upload and also in the dialog/modal close handler to guarantee the camera is always released.
- After stopping the stream, reset related state variables (like setStream(null) or setIsCameraOpen(false)) to keep UI and hardware in sync.

END DATE : TOMORROW

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12097
activity.text:
@abhimanyurajeesh can you assign me this issue 

issue 1 solution :  
-  make the parent tab (like "Settings") check if any of its sub-tabs are active, and if so, highlight the parent as active too. Use the same logic for both expanded and collapsed sidebar states so the highlight always matches the user's current location.

issue 2 solution : 
- make the sidebar highlight a tab if the current route starts with that tabâ€™s base path, so even when navigating to deeper pages (like a specific encounter), the main section (e.g., "Encounters") stays visibly active. This keeps users oriented, no matter how deep they go.

END DATE : TODAY

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12058
activity.text:
@rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan  can you please assign me the issue 

- The country selector uses a Popover (Radix UI) in the CountrySelect component (phone-input.tsx)
- When a country is selected (onChange in CountrySelectOption), the popover does not automatically close
- this is because the popoverâ€™s open state is not controlled in response to a selection; it is only controlled by the trigger.

SOLUTION :

- Use a useState hook in CountrySelect to manage the open state of the popover.
- When a country is selected (onChange) and  also set the popoverâ€™s open state to false

END DATE : TODAY

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12073
activity.text:
@rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan  can you please assign me this issue 

this issue occurs only when the person is logout from the facility page in mobile view 
after logout from the facility page in mobile view, input labels become unclickable and login fails until a hard refreshâ€”the issue is almost certainly caused by stale React context, event listeners, or DOM overlays that are not being properly reset or unmounted on logout. This is a classic React SPA  zombie state or stuck overlay problem, especially common with custom sidebars, modals, or mobile navigation components.

SOLUTION : 
-  Before navigating to /login, ensure that any sidebar or mobile overlay is closed.
-  Access the sidebar context in logout logic and call setOpen(false) and setOpenMobile(false) if available.
- Ensure any event listeners are removed on logout or when the sidebar is unmounted.

END DATE : 2 Days

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12037
activity.text:
@khavinshankar @rithviknishad  as a part of discussion  i think allowing camera feed view but restricting camera movements would be a good option because : 
- Nurses can observe the patientâ€™s condition in real-time.
- in critical care settings, seeing the feed may help with patient awareness or coordination.
- Nurses can act quickly without needing to ask doctors for every update.
-  More responsive care without giving full control keeps everyone informed.

 **As a organisation, we should consider  maximum patient privacy without compromising operational efficiency. If nurses need the camera feed to make faster decisions, we should be  okay with them seeing it â€” but they must not control it. Weâ€™ll strictly log all access and review compliance**

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12003
activity.text:
@Jacobjeevan @rithviknishad this would be my approach can you assign me this issue 

solution:      
updating the handleMarkAsComplete function in EncounterActions.tsx to ensure that when an encounter is marked as completed, the period.end field is set to the current date and time (if it is not already set). This guarantees that the end date will be accurately reflected for completed encounters, resolving the issue where it previously displayed as "ongoing.

- When marking an encounter as completed, the end date is now set to the current timestamp if it was not already present.
 
END DATE : TODAY
